intro: Eritrichium jacquemontii, commonly known as Jacquemont's alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, basal leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sensitive species in its native range.
